title: UPDATE: Youth charged in westside Savannah shooting death of 11-year-old playmate
content:
The two young boys were handling a gun at a house on the 1400 block of Church Street when it fired, said Julian Miller, Savannah-Chatham police spokesman.
Police did not immediately say how the children obtained the weapon or whether adults were present at the time of the shooting.
Montrez Burroughs of the 800 block of Joe Street was struck. The child later died at Memorial University Medical Center.
The 12-year-old, who is being held at the Regional Youth Detention Center, has been charged with involuntary manslaughter, reckless conduct and possession of a firearm by a person under 18, Miller said.
Police had several blocks cordoned off with crime scene tape as they investigated Friday night. Onlookers crowded near the yellow tape from several directions as violent crimes detectives and forensics investigators worked the scene.
Miller said the investigation is ongoing.
